name: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development
mission: CONDUCTING WORSHIP SERVICES, CHILDREN AND ADULT RELIGIOUS EDUCATION, FUNERAL FACILITY AND OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICES.
theoryOfChange: By providing accessible Islamic education and essential life-to-legacy services (like burial), the organization strengthens community identity and moral grounding.

all_citations.claim: The charity maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio and holds 126.5 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its perfect program expense ratio and strong liquidity, though it lacks the transparency of a formal third-party rating.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data available regarding specific program outcomes and impact metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization serves as a medium fit for donors interested in religious and cultural preservation through its cemetery and academy programs [3]. As a sadaqah-eligible entity, it provides a consistent track record of community service, though the urgency is categorized as religious-cultural rather than emergency-based [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity focuses on capacity building through religious and educational infrastructure, maintaining a 100.0% program expense Ratio [1][2]. While the organization demonstrates significant financial health with 126.5 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available evidence regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary outcomes [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development provides comprehensive religious services and educational programming through its dedicated community facilities.
strengths: Maintains a program expense ratio of 100.0%, directing all functional expenses toward mission-related activities
Exceptional financial stability with 126.5 months of working capital available
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Indiana, the organization manages the Abraar Academy and the American Muslim Cemetery while conducting regular worship services and funeral facilities [1][3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported a total revenue of $2,011,605 to support its mission of religious education and community development [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its perfect program expense ratio and strong liquidity, though it lacks the transparency of a formal third-party rating.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization holds <cite id="11">over 126.5 months of working capital in reserve</cite>, which may suggest a need for more aggressive deployment of funds into community services.
There is <cite id="16">no publicly available data for cost-per-beneficiary</cite>, making it difficult to assess the relative efficiency of its educational programs.

bbb_assessment.summary: Organization has not been formally evaluated by BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is in a growth phase, with revenue increasing by <cite id="5">11.2% annually</cite>.
risk_factors: <cite id="11">126.5 months of working capital</cite> may indicate under-utilization of donor funds.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="11">excessive accumulation of unrestricted net assets</cite> relative to annual spending.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data current through 2023 tax year
data_gaps: Missing detailed employee and volunteer counts
confidence.notes: Financial efficiency data is robust, but impact transparency is limited.

alignment.explanation: The organization serves a <cite id="20">niche religious-cultural cause area</cite> with a 14-year track record of serving the Muslim community.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="21">clearly stating whether specific programs are eligible for sadaqah</cite> or other specific donation types.

credibility.explanation: Donors can verify the organization's standing through its <cite id="17">registered 501(c)(3) status</cite> and <cite id="15">fully independent board of directors</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="18">publish its board member identities</cite> and formalize its governance disclosures.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="6">100.0% program ratio</cite>, though <cite id="16">missing beneficiary data</cite> prevents a full cost-effectiveness analysis.
impact.improvement: The charity should <cite id="19">publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess reserves</cite> into mission delivery while maintaining a reasonable reserve floor.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes with developing theory of change

rich_narrative.headline: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development provides comprehensive religious services and educational programming through its dedicated community facilities.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize local community infrastructure and want their entire contribution to go directly to program costs without any fundraising overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to support Islamic education and cemetery services in the US
Prefer organizations with extremely high financial stability
Interested in supporting established community institutions
giving_considerations: Donations are currently classified as sadaqah-eligible
The organization holds very large reserves, meaning there is no immediate liquidity crisis
Impact is focused on local Indiana community services
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international emergency relief or those who require rigorous RCT-level evidence of social impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects <cite id="22">verified outcomes</cite> in religious education, such as <cite id="23">Hifdh completion requirements</cite>, but lacks external impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CITCD provides a lifecycle of religious services—from <cite id="8">youth education at Abraar Academy</cite> to <cite id="9">funeral services</cite>—to maintain Islamic identity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are meeting religious proficiency standards for students.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While revenue is growing, the <cite id="11">large reserve balance</cite> suggests the organization has significant internal capacity.

peer_comparison.differentiator: CITCD stands out with a <cite id="6">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> compared to a <cite id="10">peer median of 89.1%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">100.0% of its functional expenses</cite> toward mission-related programs, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">peer program ratio median of 89.1%</cite>.
CITCD maintains <cite id="11">126.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer for long-term operational stability.
The charity operates with <cite id="7">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring donor contributions are not diluted by marketing overhead.

strengths_deep_dive: The Center's financial health is anchored by its <cite id="12">$6,131,548 in total assets</cite>, which has grown steadily from $3.4 million in 2021. This growth is driven by a diverse revenue stream, including <cite id="13">$1,124,154 from contributions</cite> and <cite id="14">$887,451 in program service revenue</cite>. This dual-income model, combining community donations with fee-for-service programs like the Abraar Academy, creates a sustainable financial foundation. Furthermore, the organization operates with <cite id="15">100% independent board members</cite>, ensuring high levels of objective oversight for its $2 million annual budget.
rich_narrative.summary: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development (CITCD) is an Indiana-based institution dedicated to providing <cite id="1">comprehensive religious services and educational programming</cite>. Since its <cite id="2">founding in 2012</cite>, the organization has expanded its footprint to include the <cite id="3">Abraar Academy and the American Muslim Cemetery</cite>, addressing critical lifecycle needs for the local Muslim community. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $2,011,605</cite>, reflecting a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 11.2%</cite>. A defining characteristic of CITCD is its financial efficiency; the organization maintains a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 100.0%</cite>, ensuring that all functional expenses are directed toward its mission-related activities. This is supported by <cite id="7">high fundraising efficiency</cite>, with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised. Beyond worship, the center provides <cite id="8">children and adult religious education</cite> and specialized facilities such as a <cite id="9">funeral facility and banquet hall</cite> to foster community cohesion.
